citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are free or freemium options that can help with live translation during calls or real-time spoken conversations, especially with French speakers ‚Äî but note the limits and differences in how they work: üì± Apps for Real-Time Spoken Translation 1) Google Translate (mobile) Free, supports French & many languages. Has Conversation / live translate mode where you speak and it translates both sides in real time. Not native in-call audio integration (like overlay on phone calls), but works if both people talk into the app. Journal du Freenaute

sources.title: Instant Voice Translate - Apps on Google Play
sources.snippet: "Instant Voice Translate" is a free and user-friendly language translation app powered by cutting-edge AI technology. Whether you're traveling abroad or connecting with people who speak different languages, this AI-powered app is your reliable companion. FEATURES 1. Voice Translation: Speak naturally and let the app provide instant translations in real-time. Communicate effortlessly and break ...

citation_mappings.claim_text: 2) Instant Voice Translate (Erudite / ‚ÄúTraduction Vocale Instant‚Äù) Free voice-to-voice translation in real time (you speak, it translates). Works for in-person or speaker/mic setups; not tied to normal phone dialer. Google Play+1

sources.title: TalkPersona - Free real-time voice translator
sources.snippet: In addition to the AI video chatbot, TalkPersona also offers a free Instant Voice Translator for Real-Time Multilingual Conversations. It enables seamless real-time cross-language conversations. Always listens and instantly translates between your language and foreign languages, with optional audio playback. Perfect for travel, business, and cross-language communication.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 3) TalkPersona Instant Voice Translator Free web-based real-time voice translator that listens and translates on the fly. Good for direct conversation scenarios (not phone call dialer). TalkPersona
